body.bibl: Lewis, Agnes Smith. Acta Mythologica Apostolorum, Transcribed from an Arabic Ms. in the Convent of Deyr-Es-Suriani, Egypt, and from Mss. in the Convent of St Catherine, on Mount Sinai, with Two Legends from a Vatican Ms by Prof. Ignazio Guidi, and an Appendix of Syriac Palimpsest Fragments of the Acts of Judas Thomas from Cod. Sin. Syr. 30. Horae Semiticae 3. London: C.J. Clay and Sons, 1904.

Agnes Smith Lewis, Acta Mythologica Apostolorum, Transcribed from an Arabic Ms. in the Convent of Deyr-Es-Suriani, Egypt, and from Mss. in the Convent of St Catherine, on Mount Sinai, with Two Legends from a Vatican Ms by Prof. Ignazio Guidi, and an Appendix of Syriac Palimpsest Fragments of the Acts of Judas Thomas from Cod. Sin. Syr. 30, Horae Semiticae 3 (London: C.J. Clay and Sons, 1904).
